posts.cooked: I‚Äôve started to use view once media a lot and I‚Äôd love to be able to do it via the desktop app.

Necrobumping this because I just encountered this and was surprised it wasn‚Äôt supported.

Particularly because mobile phone software like Google Photos and iCloud Photos can be really aggressive in automatically backing up images that are saved to the device. Sometimes I want to send an image to a friend without worrying that software on my phone will try and backup the image. It‚Äôs not an issue on the recipient side, because the view-once image isn‚Äôt usually saved (unless the recipient screenshots it, but that‚Äôs a matter of opsec on the recipient‚Äôs end).

Currently you could do something like this:

  • Sender disables automatic backups in iCloud Photos/Google Photos
  • Sender sends themselves an image from their desktop using the Signal Desktop client and the ‚ÄúNote to Self‚Äù feature
  • Sender receives the image from themselves on their mobile device and saves the image on their mobile device
  • Sender sends the image to the actual recipient as a view-once message using the Signal app
  • Sender deletes the image from the sender‚Äôs mobile device
  • Sender reenables automatic backups in iCloud Photos/Google Photos

But that sucks, is complicated, and also leaves a forensic footprint and has externalities (for example, the cloud provider knows that a user disabled photo backups on their device at a given timestamp, there‚Äôs potentially filesystem metadata created from the act of transferring the image to the mobile device, deleting the image via the OS might not fully delete it, the image could be in the filesystem trash, the mobile device‚Äôs OS could‚Äôve generated thumbnails of the original image even if it was never backed up to the cloud, etc).

The Signal Desktop client really should support sending view-once images. (Big fan of Signal and Signal contributors, would love to see this supported!)

Once it‚Äôs in the ‚Äúnote to self‚Äù in the mobile client, forward it to the other recipient as view once. There is no need to do anything with iCloud, Google Photos, nor anything else since the media never leaves Signal.
